lead_paragraph: Four years removed from making a run at the Triple Crown, Funny Cide returned to the winner’s circle yesterday at Finger Lakes Gaming and Racetrack in Farmington, N.Y. He drove past the pace-setting Johnie Bye Night down the stretch to win the 31st running of the $100,000 Wadsworth Memorial Handicap. The 7-year-old Funny Cide, the winner of the Kentucky Derby and the Preakness Stakes in 2003, had not won in six consecutive outings, but the one-and-one-eighth-mile test for 3-year-olds and up proved to his liking. A near-record crowd of more than 12,000 cheered his every stride as he covered the distance in 1 minute 51.77 seconds.
